Articles.Content:
For my initial offering, I present to you the Speed Demon I:

![Aj1fH.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/Aj1fH.jpg)

This helo offers a cruising speed of nearly 100 m/s at a stable altitude. This craft was tested at an altitude of 290 meters.

The Speed Demon II

The cruising speed at 125 meters altitude with a 1 m/s altitude gain is 86m/s. Range is potentially 250 kilometers based on a rough extrapolation of a 50km flight. 

You may think this is not impressive and is in fact a downgrade from the Speed Demon I. Well, you\'d be wrong! Our new \'boost\' feature increases the speed by an astonishing 57%. Simply toggle the auxiliary thrusters and engage!

![8cpO5.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/8cpO5.jpg)

Handling can be a tad tricky for both craft; the attached ASAS ring is extremely helpful.

Parts: C7 everything, Damned Aerospace for the rotor, and Down Under for the ASAS ring.

Speed Demon I is Proto-1; Speed Demon II is Proto-2.

That looks very cool. Very Russianesque design to it.

BTW, I think you meant 'Fling-Wing,' 'Fixed-Wing' refers to planes, 'Fling-Wing' refers to helos. ![;)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif)
Or rotary-wing. Either way, it looks cool.

> 
> That looks very cool. Very Russianesque design to it.
> 
> BTW, I think you meant 'Fling-Wing,' 'Fixed-Wing' refers to planes, 'Fling-Wing' refers to helos. ![;)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif)

Thank you, and noted.
